Job description

An experienced Change & Communications Manager\xa0is needed for a 6 month full-time contract role in Melbourne CBD.


As an adaptable, collaborative, hands-on and dynamic person\xa0who likes fast-paced project roles, you will be responsible for multiple projects in relation to a security uplift program. With an understanding of the difference between technical change and business changes, you will work with relevant stakeholders to provide high quality outcomes so that organisational requirements are met.\xa0


Your primary tasks will include to:


  • Lead Change and Communication for projects within a security uplift program
  • Deliver technology change in complex environments across multiple buinsess units
  • Collaborative stakeholder engagement and partnerships with business leaders
  • Idenitfy change impacts and develop corresponding learning/training plans
  • Ensure changes are embedded and adoption of new tools being maximised


Previous experience with technology and/or security implications, digital projects and/or identity and access management is preferred.

Business Analyst
Job ID: 551360
Job type: Full Time - Permanent
Location: Somerton
Categories: Engineering (All disciplines), Finance & Administration

Who We Are

Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure and facilities.

Position Summary

Downer's Road Services business unit is one of the largest non-government owned road services businesses in Australia. We operate from a network of over 50 depots and maintain more than 36,000 km of road. Our Business is involved in many exciting ventures within the civil road industry throughout the country. Downer continues to be an innovator in the sustainable asphalt industry, running plants that use recyclable products and environmentally sustainable methods.

We are seeking a talented Business Analyst to join our collaborative, high performing team. Based in Somerton, this pivotal role will actively identify, drive and manage national and local business improvements within the Roads Business. You will be working on a number of diverse, interesting projects where your self-driven approach and ability to work autonomously will be valued.

About You

You will possess tertiary qualifications in Business, Engineering or a relevant discipline and sound experience in:
  • 3-5 years’ experience ideally gained within the Construction Industry
  • Researching, sourcing and collating information
  • Presenting complex information and the ability to tailor presentations to a diverse workforce
  • Ability to contribute to the development of financial budgets and business planning process
  • Experience in researching and understanding complex information to develop and implement business improvement solutions
  • Demonstrated ability to analyse financial information
  • Proficient project planning, organisational and time management skills
  • Basic understanding of regulations and legislation applied to the civil construction industry is desirable but not essential
  • Strong safety focus - actively participate in and support Downer Zero Harm initiatives and strategies


What We Offer
  • Highly supportive, team orientated organisation
  • A strong commitment to Zero Harm environment for all our employees and visitors
  • Competitive remuneration with on-going training and support
  • A long-term career opportunity for working with an ASX listed company

For more information please contact: Helen Kruimel – Talent & Sourcing Business Partner, Infrastructure Services, mobile number 0409 072 562 quoting job number 549092

How To Apply

To apply for this great opportunity please click the apply now button

Downer does not accept any unsolicited resume referrals from Recruitment Agencies. Please do not submit any resumes or associated profiles to the Downer careers portal or to any Downer employees. Downer will not pay any placement fees relating to unsolicited resume referrals.

How To Apply

To apply for this great opportunity please click the apply now button

Closing Date: 26 Sep 2018 AUS Eastern Standard Time

814438968:
[

Technical Customer Service Consultant

Company Name PPG Industries Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 89 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

PPG Industries

At PPG, we strengthen and enhance the world, working every day to develop and deliver the paints, coatings, and materials that our customers have trusted for more than 130 years. Through dedication and creativity, we solve our customers’ biggest challenges, collaborating closely to find the right path forward. With headquarters in Pittsburgh, US, we operate and innovate in more than 70 countries. We serve customers in construction, consumer products, industrial and transportation markets, and aftermarkets. To learn more about what we do, visit www.ppg.com.

About The Role

We have a current vacancy for a Technical Customer Service Consultant supporting our Refinish business. The fundamental purpose of this role is to assist our customers with technical queries relating to our product range. We are looking for someone with a background as a spray painter who can relate to our customers and trouble shoot complex technical queries relating to the application of our products.

You will be supporting our customer base in Western Australia but be based at our Clayton site, so this role will suit someone who is looking for a role with a later start and finish time. Working in a tightknit team you will work well under pressure and be able to deliver outstanding service to our customers primarily in the automotive refinish industry.

Duties & Responsibilities Include
  • Support our customers over the phone by providing technical advice
  • Ensure compliance with material safety/technical data sheets
  • Building productive working relationships with other departments including sales, logistics, demand planning and production
  • Deliver a proactive, professional and specialized service by the receipt, process and release of customer orders and credits
  • Provide accurate and timely colour formulations as requested by PPG customers
  • Provide PPG customers with accurate information on stock availability and delivery enquiries

Requires
  • Qualified spray-painter / applicator
  • Knowledge of the appropriate PPG products an advantage
  • Knowledge of the Production and Distribution functions an advantage
  • Intermediate working knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Excel & Word packages.
  • Working knowledge of Oracle 11i data entry an advantage
  • Strong communication skills

PPG on Diversity

PPG embraces diversity and equal employment opportunities at all levels of the organisation. In addition to an active Women's Leadership Council, PPG is a member of NAWO (National Association of Women in Operations) and is a WGEA Employer of Choice for Gender Equality. We are committed to supporting and enhancing diversity; as such, we encourage applications from all backgrounds to apply for this opportunity.

Industry

  • Building Materials
  • Chemicals
  • Construction

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Customer Service
  • Information Technology

Software Engineer

Company Name Wisenet Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 162 views

Job description

What’s the role?

Wisenet is looking for a .Net Developer, with AWS platform experience, who has what it takes to become a key member of a small but talented product team in Melbourne, delivering cutting edge software solutions.

\xa0

Throughout the years, the Wisenet brand has stood for excellence and reliability in the education industry and Wisenet is constantly on the search for passionate, creative minded people to continue to make this happen.


As a member of the product team you will play an important role in the the delivery of a wide range of exciting software solutions for education providers to manage the Learner Lifecycle. There is opportunity to work on a range of technologies including the continued evolution of our product using serverless architecture best practices on AWS.

Projects

  • Extending our new API

  • Extending events architecture to process more advanced workflows and integrations

  • New Sales and Online Application Module

  • New Tenant, Licensing and User Management

  • New Claims Auth Implementation

  • Plus many others


About You
You are a proactive technologist with a passion for SaaS products and Agile delivery. You have experience/interest in DevOps practices, don't believe in re-inventing the wheel, enjoy working on the full range of development tasks, don't shy away from owning your work and have a 'can do' attitude. Critically, you must be able to communicate solutions and issues effectively with the team, the business and stakeholders. We're not looking for Lone Wolves.

\xa0

Desired Skills

Successful candidates will likely have a minimum of 3 years experience in a professional capacity and a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field. Don't be scared by our wish list... simply the more the better:

  • Commercial experience in a similar position, preferably with DevOps practices

  • Have professional experience working as an active participant in an Agile team

  • Experience using JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo & Git (or equivalent)

  • Strong skills with C# / .NET Framework & .NET Core

  • Skills in web fundamentals such as HTML5, CSS3 & JavaScript/jQuery

  • Experience with AWS such as DynamoDB, Lambda, StepFunctions, S3, CloudWatch

  • Experience with React/Angular

  • Current AWS and/or Microsoft certification will be highly regarded

  • Must have a desire for continuous learning and professional development

An excellent learning culture is present here providing a great opportunity for the right \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 candidate. We will help with skill gaps.\xa0

\xa0

Interested?  

This is a great opportunity that will offer you long-term personal and professional development with competitive compensation. Applications will only be accepted from candidates that have the appropriate approval to work permanently in Australia. Successful applicants will be required to complete background screening prior to commencement of employment.


We look forward to hearing from you!

Recruitment Resourcer

Company Name Invisible Partners Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 76 views

Job description

Invisible Partners has a talented invisible workforce, who deliver amazing people and team outcomes for our clients, either through developing the right hiring strategy, process design, coaching or taking recruitment off their hands entirely.\xa0


We are growing at a phenomenal rate and are excited to be expanding our movement. We say movement, because our Invisible Workforce are not the 9-5’ers. You might be raising a young family, working on a collection of side-hustles or have another part-time role and want to supplement your income. For experienced Recruiters, Resourcers, Market Researchers and HR generalists, we offer a creative and interesting way of capitalising on your experience in a completely flexible way.\xa0


We prioritise exceptional service and are proud to deliver outcomes that leave our clients shouting from the rooftops.\xa0 We engage our workforce on a project basis, you’ll indicate what hours you can commit to, and we’ll allocate tasks accordingly. You can work from home, a Bali beach, whilst your babies are napping or in our fancy pants office in Melbourne’s CBD, we are ALL about collaboration, kick ass service and measuring successes on outcomes – not time chained at a desk.\xa0


We are looking to build a varied ‘bench’, so if you have experience anywhere in the spectrum of recruitment and HR consulting – we’d love to hear from you.\xa0 Get in touch with Director, Sarah Piper by email sarah@invisiblepartners.com.au with an indication of your employee experience superpower, your CV and what your ideal availability is and we'll be in touch.\xa0

[

Portfolio Accountant

Company Name Knight Frank Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 205 views

Job description

  • Fantastic opportunity to build your career with a respected global organisation
  • Deliver innovative solutions
  • Great team environment


We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced Portfolio Accountant to join our Client Accounting Services team. This team is responsible for ensuring that our client's property accounting requirements are delivered and their service expectations are met and exceeded.


The Portfolio Accountant will have responsibility for a client portfolio and will be required to ensure delivery of services in line with the terms of the client contracts and agreed service levels.


Core responsibilities of this role include:

  • Deliver effective and consistent financial management of client portfolios
  • Work closely with their client portfolio to understand their needs and ensure that their contracted services have been delivered.
  • Review and analyse financial results of client portfolios.
  • Develop strong relationships with clients and act as the first point of contact for any queries
  • Review information systems and processes to ensure they meet the needs of the client portfolio
  • Provide training on our accounting systems and processes to clients and property managers
  • Ensure compliance to all relevant policies, processes, guidelines and standards
  • Identify and implement necessary process change where improvement opportunities exist.

The successful candidate will have:

  • Property Accounting experience within a major property group
  • Portfolio management experience
  • Degree qualification in Accounting
  • Experience with various accounting systems including Management Reporting International (MRI).
  • Strong client service focus
  • Strong project management skills
  • Ability to think innovatively
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills including training and presentation skills


In return we offer a competitive remuneration package and staff benefits, centrally located offices close to public transport, and the opportunity to join our team of committed professionals driven to make their mark in the property industry


Applicants with Australian working rights only please.


No Agencies please.
